column1: # Division by zero
Division by zero ¤ 3 / 0 ¤ at '/'
Division by zero ¤ 0 / 0 ¤ at '/'
Division by zero ¤ 1.5 / 0 ¤ at '/'
Division by zero ¤ 1.5 % 0 ¤ at '%'
# Unary operator
Unary - ¤ - true ¤ at '-'
# Undefined variables (symbols)
Undefined symbol in expression ¤ a ¤ at 'a'
Undefined symbol in multiple expression ¤ b + a ¤ at 'b'
Undefined symbol in assignment ¤ a = 10 ¤ at 'a'
Undefined symbol in chained assignment ¤ var a; c = b = a = 10 ¤ at 'b'
Uninitialized variable ¤ var a; 10 + a + 5 ¤ at 'a'
# Compound assignment
Compound + ¤ var n = 200; n += 5; n ¤ /100
Compound + ¤ var n = ""str""; n += 55; n ¤ /100
Compound - ¤ var n = 200; n -= 5; n ¤ /100
Compound * ¤ var n = 200; n *= 2; n ¤ /100
Compound / ¤ var n = 200; n /= 4; n ¤ /100
Compound ** ¤ var n = 2; n **= 10; n ¤ /100
Compound % ¤ var n = 200; n %= 30; n ¤ /100
Compound and ¤ var n = 200; n and= 30; n ¤ /100
Compound and ¤ var n = 0; n and= 30; n ¤ /100
Compound or ¤ var n = 200; n or= 30; n ¤ /100
Compound or ¤ var n = 0; n or= 30; n ¤ /100
# Block scope
Undefined variable out of scope ¤ var b = 20; { var a = 10; print a; } b + a ¤ undefined identifier 'a'
# For loop
For loop local variable out of scope ¤ for (var a = 0; a < 5; a = a + 1); a ¤ undefined identifier 'a'
# Break & continue
Break outside loop ¤ while (1); break; ¤ at 'break'
Continue outside loop ¤ while (1); continue; ¤ at 'continue'
Break outside loop ¤ while (1) { fun f() { break; } }; ¤ at 'break'
Continue outside loop ¤ while (1) { fun f() { continue; } }; ¤ at 'continue'
Multiple break outside loop ¤ break; while (1); break; ¤ /002
Multiple continue outside loop ¤ continue; while (1); continue; ¤ /002
Multiple break and continue outside loop ¤ continue; while (1) { fun f() { break; continue; } }; break; ¤ /E4
Dead code after break ¤ while (1) { print 10; break; print 20; } ¤ /110
Dead code after break ¤ while (1) { print 10; { break; } print 20; } ¤ /110
Dead code after continue ¤ while (0) { print 10; { continue; break; } print 20; } ¤ /020
# Increment & Decrement
Increment boolean ¤ var i = true; ++i ¤ at '[+][+]'
Decrement string ¤ var str = "a"; --str ¤ at '--'
Decrement nil ¤ var str = nil; --str ¤ at '--'
# Native functions
Native clock takes 0 arg
Native clock takes 0 arg
Native lineSeparator takes 0 arg
Native exit takes 1 arg
Native exit takes 1 arg
Native exit expect number arg ¤ exit(false) ¤ at '[(]'
Native exit expect number arg ¤ exit(""string"") ¤ at '[(]'
Native exit expect number arg ¤ exit(nil) ¤ at '[(]'
# Return
# TODO move to Static Analysis
Return outside any function 1 ¤ return; ¤ return outside function
Return outside any function 2 ¤ { return; } ¤ return outside function
Dead code 1 ¤ fun f() { print 30; return; 10; 20; } f(); ¤ /120
Dead code 2 ¤ fun f() { print 30; { return; print 10; } print 20; } f(); ¤ /120
# Lexical scope
Lexical scope 1 (var after fun)  ¤ fun plus(a) { print a + b; }; var b = 10; plus(5); ¤ /001
# Redefinition
Redefinition global ok ¤ var a = 10; var a = 20; print a; ¤ /100
Redefinition local bad ¤ { var a = 10; var a = 20; fun a() {}; print a; } ¤ /002
Redefinition parameters bad ¤ fun plus(b
Redefinition sub block ok ¤ { var a = 10; { var a = 20; print a; } print a; } ¤ /200
Redefinition parameter in body bad ¤ fun f(a) { var a = 10; print a; } f(5); ¤ /001
Redefinition parameter in body bad ¤ var f = fun (a) { var a = 10; print a; }; f(5); ¤ /001
# Unused symbol: variable
Unused global ok ¤ var a = 10; ¤ /000
Unused local variable bad ¤ { var b = 10; } ¤ /010
Unused local function bad ¤ { fun f() 10; } ¤ /010
Unused local parameter bad ¤ { fun f(p) 10; } ¤ /020
Used in sub-block ok ¤ { var b = 10; { print b; } } ¤ /100
Used in sub-function ok ¤ { var b = 10; fun f(){ print b; }; f(); } ¤ /100
Unused reflexive function 1 ¤ { fun f() f(); } ¤ /010
Unused reflexive function 2 ¤ { fun facto(n) n <= 2 ? n : n * facto (n - 1); } ¤ /010
Unused sub reflexive ¤ { fun f() { fun g() { f(); } return g; }} ¤  /010
# Class
Class declaration ¤ class C { } print C; ¤ *class C
Class declaration unused ¤ { class C { } } ¤ /010
Class declaration with methods 1 ¤ class CC { write () { \n } \n } print CC; ¤ *class CC
Class declaration with methods 2 ¤ class CC { write (a) { print a; } } print CC; ¤ *class CC
# TODO function 'write' is unused in the following (was fine before introducing a new scope for self)
Class declaration with methods (local) ¤ { class CC { write () { \n } \n } print CC; } ¤ /100
Class instantiation ¤ class D { } D() ¤ /100
Class field ¤ class C{} var c = C(); c.field = 10; c.field ¤ /100
Class field undefined ¤ class C{} var c = C(); c.field ¤ /001
Class not valid instance ¤ 10.size ¤ /001
column2: left side of '.size' is not an instance

column1: Class not valid instance ¤ 10.max = 30 ¤ /001
column2: left side of '.max' is not an instance

column1: Class field chained ¤ class C{} var c = C(); c.alpha = C(); c.alpha.beta = 12; c.alpha.beta ¤ /100
Class field indirect ¤ class C{} var c = C(); fun f() c; f().gamma = 32; f().gamma ¤ /100
Class method get ¤ class C { hello(name) { print ""hello "" + name; } } var c = C(); c.hello ¤ /100
Class method call ¤ class C { hello(name) { print ""hello "" + name; } } var c = C(); c.hello(33); ¤ /100
Class field increment ¤ class C {} var c = C(); c.num = 98; ++c.num; print c.num; ¤ /100
Class field decrement ¤ class C {} var c = C(); c.num = 98; --c.num; print c.num; ¤ /100
# Self
Self is not usable as a variable ¤ var self = 0; ¤ /001
Self is not usable as a function name ¤ fun self(){} ¤ /001
Self is not usable as a parameter name ¤ fun f(self){} ¤ /001
Self is not usable as a class name ¤ class self{} ¤ /001
# TODO report only one error for the following error (synchronization problem)
Self is not usable as a method name ¤ class C { self(){} \n} ¤ /002
Self cannot be redefined ¤ class C { f(){ self = 4; } } ¤ /001
Self is not defined outside a class 1 ¤ print self; ¤ /001
Self is not defined outside a class 2 ¤ fun f() { print self; } ¤ /001
Self inside class ¤ class C { info() { print self; }} C().info(); ¤ /100
# Constructor (init)
Init simple ¤ class C { init() { print 10; } } C(); C(); ¤ /200
Init with params ¤ class Bed { init(size) { self.size = size; } } var bed = Bed(20); bed.size ¤ /100
Init with bad arity ¤ class Bed { init(size) { self.size = size; } } var bed = Bed(20
Init with bad arity ¤ class Bed { init(size) { self.size = size; } } var bed = Bed(); bed.size ¤ /001
Init direct invocation ¤ class Bed { init(size) { self.size = size; } } var bed = Bed(10); bed.init(20); bed.size ¤ /100
Init return self ¤ class Bed { init(size) { self.size = size; } } var bed = Bed(10); bed.init(20).init(30); bed.size ¤ /100
Init return self upon return ¤ class Bed { init(size) { self.size = size; return; } } var bed = Bed(10); bed.init(20).init(30); bed.size ¤ /100
Init cannot return a value ¤ class C { init() { return 10; } } ¤ /001
# Superclass
Superclass simple ¤ class Sup { } class Inf < Sup { } print Inf; ¤ /100
Superclass must be a class ¤ var Value = 10; class C < Value { } ¤ /001
Superclass cannot be the class itself ¤ class C < C {} ¤ /001
# Super
Super not available outside classes ¤ super.error ¤ /001
Super in class must have a superclass ¤ class C { m() { super.error(); } } ¤ /001
Super simple ¤ class C { m() { print 10; }} class D < C { f() { super.m(); }} var d = D(); d.f(); ¤ /100
Super target method not found (runtime) ¤ class C {} class D < C { f() super.m(); } D().f(); ¤ /001
column3: class 'D' has no superclasses accepting method 'm'

column1: # TODO: Super target method not found (static analysis) ¤ class C {} class D < C { f() super.m(); } ¤ /001
column2: class 'D' has no superclasses accepting method 'm'

column1: # Explicit super (single inheritance)
Super explicit not available outside classes ¤ super(C).error ¤ /001
Super explicit in class must have a superclass ¤ class C { m() { super(E).error(); } } ¤ /001
Super explicit simple ¤ class C { m() { print 10; }} class D < C { f() { super(C).m(); }} var d = D(); d.f(); ¤ /100
Super explicit target must be a superclass ¤ class C { m() { print 10; }} class D < C { f() { super(E).m(); }} ¤ /001
column3: class E is not a direct superclass of D

column1: Super explicit target method not found (runtime) ¤ class C {} class D < C { f() super(C).m(); } D().f(); ¤ /001
# Multiple inheritance (MI)
MI distinct methods ¤ class C { c() 10; } class D { d() 20; } class E < C
MI method priority 1 ¤ class C { m() 10; } class D { m() 20; } class E < C
MI method priority 2 ¤ class C { m() 10; } class D { m() 20; } class E < D
MI method priority 3 super explicit ¤ class C { m() 10; } class D { m() 20; } class E < D
column2: C { m() super(C).m(); } var e = E(); e.m() ¤ /100

column1: MI inheriting from itself ¤ class C {  } class D < C
MI inheriting twice  ¤ class C {  } class D < C
column4: class can't be inherited more than once

column1: # Properties
Global property ¤ var a = 10; fun b : 2 * a; print b; ++a; print b; ¤ /200
Instance property ¤ class Circle { \n init(radius) self.radius = radius; \n diameter : self.radius * 2; } Circle(10).diameter ¤ /100
Class properties are readonly ¤ class C { p:10; } var c = C(); print c.p; c.p = 20; ¤ /101
Class methods are readonly ¤ class C { p() 10; } var c = C(); print c.p(); c.p = 20; ¤ /101
# Class methods
Class methods simple ¤ class Math { class pi : 3.14159; class square(x) x * x; } print Math.pi; print Math.square(12); ¤ /200
Class methods undefined ¤ class Math { } print Math.pi; ¤ /001
Instance methods cannot be used directly ¤ class C { ten: 10; twenty: 2*ten; five: twenty / 4; } C().twenty ¤ /002
Class methods cannot use self ¤ class C { class v: self.value; } print C().v; ¤ /001
